basis: The user consistently agrees to implement concrete steps (two Snack Pause reminders, yogurt-and-berries snack, logging, post-snack reflection) and plans to test tonight, indicating strong alignment with the suggested plan.
cognitive_dissonance: Some tension between wanting to monitor mood/heat connections and avoiding over-monitoring BED; plans to keep reflections short and adjustable if intrusive.
negative_thought_patterns: All-or-nothing thinking about reminders; worry that reminders could be intrusive; perfectionism around logging; concern that monitoring could feed BED symptoms.
emotional_triggers: Heat/temperature in Suwon, cravings, mood fluctuations, BED-related concerns about control and monitoring.
coaching_notes: Keep providing clear, actionable steps; offer flexibility to reduce intrusiveness (shorter reflections, optional reminders). Validate effort and successes, and frame slips as learning opportunities. Continue emphasizing warmth, practical strategies, and BED-aware pacing.
